text: Princess Iman of Jordan (born August 3, 2024) is the first daughter of Crown Prince Hussein and Princess Rajwa. She is the first granddaughter of Queen Rania and King Abdullah II of Jordan. As the daughter of the heir to the throne, Iman is part of the Hashemite royal family, the dynasty that rules the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan. The name "Iman" is of Arabic origin and means "faith". This name is common in Arabic and Islamic culture, reflecting spiritual and religious values. Iman's birth was announced by the Royal Hashemite Court, which expressed the parents' immense happiness and gratitude, asking well-wishers to consider making donations to the Al-Aman Fund for the Future of Orphans in lieu of sending gifts or flowers. == References == Category:2024 births Category:Living people Category:Jordanian princes and princesses
title: Princess Iman bint Hussein bin Abdullah
